alternative_parents.description: Inorganic chemical compounds with one or more oxygen atoms combined with another element.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nitrides

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging to either of the other non-metal Hydrides, other non-metal nitrides, other non-metal oxides, or the other non-metal sulfides.
class.name: Other non-metal organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as other non-metal nitrides. These are inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it belongs to the class of 'other non-metals'.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of −3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it belongs to the class of 'other non-metals'.
direct_parent.name: Other non-metal nitrides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of −3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it belongs to the class of 'other non-metals'.
subclass.name: Other non-metal nitrides

superclass.description: Inorganic compounds that contain only metal elements.
superclass.name: Homogeneous non-metal compounds
